__data__.text:
JOB DESCRIPTION



	JOB TITLE: Applications Analyst

	DATE: September 2022

	DEPARTMENT: Technology Services

	FLSA CLASSIFICATION: Exempt

	REPORTS TO: Enterprise Applications & Engineering Manager

	EEO CLASSIFICATION: Professional



JOB SUMMARY

The Applications Analyst, under the direction of the Sr. Manager of Enterprise Applications & Engineering, will serve as a product specialist for the firm’s legal application set.  Collaborating with other IT peers and vendors, this individual will assist with defining, configuring, and working to implement the user experience as it relates to the end-user computing environment.  This role will be a member of the firm-wide Applications & Infrastructure team serving as a subject matter expert for vendor applications that are used by the firm on a daily basis.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*

Applies systems analysis techniques and procedures including consultation with users and leadership in formulating system requirements.  Including, but not limited to, researching current or new technologies that address established requirements, advising users and management on available options, identifying and reporting on the implications of installing new or modifying current systems or configurations, and performing project management of application rollout projects.

Assists with defining the user experience for the firms end-user computing environment.  Including, but not limited to, Windows 10, Microsoft Office 365, Litera application suite (Forte, Metadact, Compare, DocXtools, Numbering, etc.) or similar products, Adobe Product Suite, and other legal applications. 

Collaborates with other IT staff, leads the planning, testing, and rollout of software upgrades as well as new system implementations within a Microsoft environment.  

Performs configuration management of firm applications.  Provides oversight and backup support for regular maintenance of applications.  Ensures preventative maintenance activities is regularly planned and implemented.

Develops and maintain test plans for various applications.

Performs regression testing for application updates and/or changes.

Contributes to and maintains technology support knowledgebase where appropriate.

Provides escalated software support and problem-resolution to computer system users.  This will include working closely with Technical Support (Help Desk) personnel to research, resolve, and document problems and their resolution

Reviews existing processes/procedures/technologies and provide suggestions to streamline and optimize the environment

Creates and updates documentation where appropriate

Completes special projects on various technologies as needed.






MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS



Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and customization options

Knowledge of software applications and customization tactics

Knowledge of legal applications and how they integrate in the legal desktop

Excellent interpersonal skills including telephone skills, verbal and written communication skills, active listening and customer care

Strong troubleshooting knowledge 

Organized and consistently executes tasks effectively and efficiently



Education:

Bachelor’s degree required or relevant equivalent experience in lieu of degree

Relevant vendor certifications, such as Microsoft Office Specialist, preferred



		Experience:

3+ years of supporting and managing a broad portfolio of legal applications

3+ years of designing application configurations, upgrade processes, and supporting documentation

3+ years of supporting internal escalation and troubleshooting of applications





		Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Vets/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		

		WORKING CONDITIONS  

		

		The following table indicates the degree of working conditions expected for the job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to meet these requirements.  

		

		N/A = 0-10%, Occasionally = 11-33%, Frequently = 34 - 66%, Constantly = 67 - 100%

__data__.text:
JOB DESCRIPTION





	JOB TITLE: Desktop Engineer

	DATE: June 2023

	DEPARTMENT: Technology Services

	FLSA CLASSIFICATION: Exempt

	REPORTS TO: Enterprise Applications & Engineering Manager

	EEO CLASSIFICATION: Professionals



JOB SUMMARY

The Desktop Engineer, under the direction of the Enterprise Applications & Engineering Manager, will manage and maintain the firms end-user computing environment.  This role will be a member of the firm-wide applications & infrastructure team leveraging Microsoft technologies across the endpoint environment. The Desktop Engineer will be responsible for establishing and executing the full lifecycle of workstation OS and Firm applications integrating with Microsoft 365 offerings, performing updates & upgrades where appropriate, along with managing the user-experience across the physical (desktop/laptop) and virtual (VDI) platforms. The Desktop Engineer will automate configurations & repetitive tasks through PowerShell scripting, GPO, and/or other methods, allowing for highly scalable and optimized deployments. In addition, by way of exceptional troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills, the Desktop Engineer will resolve escalated issues in a timely manner.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*

Administer, manage, and maintain the end-user computing environments (MECM, InTune, Citrix, Microsoft365/Office365 Suite).

Package/customize/deploy applications.

Package/deploy updates (OS/3rd party applications).

Design/build/manage/maintain task sequences and Windows image(s) for deployment through SCCM.

Design/build/manage/maintain Active Directory OUs & GPOs to customize the end user computing environment as necessary (OS/Applications).

Manage & maintain Windows VDI and Published Applications platform (Citrix)

Collaborate & communicate across IT teams to identify issues and provide/explain solutions.

Tier 3 support for internal support escalations where it relates to the end user computing platform (OS, software, and/or hardware).

Review existing processes/procedures/technologies and provide suggestions to streamline and optimize the environment.

Create and update documentation where appropriate.

Present updates on new/changing technology in the end-user computing space.  

Complete special projects on various technologies as needed.







MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Knowledge of Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager (MECM).

Knowledge of Application packaging/customization/deployment.

Knowledge of Microsoft scripting languages (Batch, VBScript, PowerShell).

Knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory & Group Policy.

Knowledge of Microsoft Cloud Desktop Management Technologies (Office365, MECM, InTune, Desktop Analytics, etc.).

Knowledge of User-Profile Management Solutions (ProfileUnity, UE-V, FSLogix, etc.).

Manage & maintain Windows virtual desktop (VDI) and/or virtual published applications platform (Citrix XenApp, VMware Horizon).

Microsoft Office configurations & functions (Templates, Styles, Quick Parts, etc.).

Ability & curiosity to discover technical deficiencies, present solutions to a peer team, and work to implement and improve the broader technology landscape.

Understands general network architecture, including switches, routers, circuits, virtual servers and data centers.

Education:

Bachelor's degree, or experience/training in lieu of degree

Relevant vendor certifications preferred



Experience:

3+ years of Managing physical Windows workstations in a multi-location Microsoft enterprise.

3+ years of OS/Software/Patch deployment with MECM.

3+ years of Active Directory/OU/GPO management for workstations.

1+ years of managing & maintaining Windows virtual desktop (VDI) and/or virtual published applications platform (Citrix XenApp, VMware Horizon).

Experience working in a legal environment preferred.





	

	

	

		Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Female/Disabled/Vets/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

		
WORKING CONDITIONS  

		

		The following table indicates the degree of working conditions expected for the job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to meet these requirements.  

		

		N/A = 0-10%, Occasionally = 11-33%, Frequently = 34 - 66%, Constantly = 67 - 100%

JOB DESCRIPTION



	JOB TITLE: Research Librarian

	DATE: August, 2023

	DEPARTMENT: Library

	FLSA CLASSIFICATION: Exempt

	REPORTS TO: Director of Library & Research Services

	EEO CLASSIFICATION: Professional


JOB SUMMARY



The Research Librarian provides reference and research assistance in support of the various legal and administrative departments throughout the Firm. The role participates in the organization of library materials and assists in continuing education regarding library resources. The Research Librarian works closely with and under the direction of the Director on Library and Research.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*



Provides research and reference assistance to attorneys in all practice areas in a timely and effective manner using various print and digital resources. Bills time to client/matters as appropriate. 

Provides research and reference assistance to support the functions of the various administrative departments of the firm, including but not limited to, Client Development, New Business/Conflicts, secretarial, paralegal and Managing Attorney Office.

Performs regular monitoring of news, dockets, legislative and regulatory changes, and other subject area monitoring as necessary. Assists in the preparation of related updates, newsletters, and other communications.

Works with Director to support the maintenance of intranet research collections by performing regular link checking and data collection/input to facilitate integration of subject-specific resources into larger firm portal.

Provides library orientation and training in print and electronic resources to library patrons.



OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



Participates in resource evaluation including pilots of new services and comparisons of resources.

Maintains working knowledge of the library print collections, digital resources, interlibrary loan availability, document delivery, and other resources as appropriate. Shows proficiency in primary database usage, search strategy and syntax, and licensing restrictions.

Performs other duties as assigned.





MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:



Broad knowledge of library tools, systems, and resources in special libraries.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel required.

Experience with research platforms, including: PACER, Courthouse News, Lexis, Westlaw, BloombergLaw, S&P Capital IQ, and Pitchbook.

Ability to work independently and collaboratively.

Excellent communication skills: oral, written, listening and interpersonal skills.

Ability to juggle multiple deadlines with good communication and attention to detail.



Education:

	Bachelor’s degree required.

MLS or MLIS Degree from an ALA accredited institution preferred. (Combination of education in a research-intensive field with relevant work experience may be considered.)

Experience:

1-3 years of law library experience is preferred.

Previous law firm experience is preferred.





	

		Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Female/Disabled/Vets/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

		
WORKING CONDITIONS  

		

		The following table indicates the degree of working conditions expected for the job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to meet these requirements.

__data__.text:
JOB DESCRIPTION



	JOB TITLE: Senior Litigation Docket Specialist

	DATE September 2022

	DEPARTMENT: Paralegals

	FLSA CLASSIFICATION: Non-exempt

	REPORTS TO: Litigation Docketing Manager

	EEO CLASSIFICATION: Administration 



JOB SUMMARY

Under general supervision, and according to established policies and procedures, the Senior Litigation Docket Specialist performs a variety of docket/calendar related and administrative duties for attorneys, paralegals and legal secretaries. This position interacts with colleagues in a team setting and upholds the image of the Firm by maintaining positive contact with clients, attorneys and staff, and observing confidentiality of client matters. 

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*

Maintain master calendar of all court deadlines. 

Calendar new events daily.

Determine court dates by reviewing relevant documents. 

Provide advanced technical support to users by researching and answering questions and troubleshooting problems

Produce calendar reports weekly and as requested to secretaries and attorneys.

Send monthly calendar reports to upper management.

Produce client or case specific calendar reports upon request.

Post updates on the Firm’s portal.

Respond to calendaring questions from Attorney, Paralegals, Secretaries.

Prepare custom calendars for timekeepers upon request.



OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Keep up-to-date with and communicate rule changes to legal personnel.

Make recommendations on calendaring procedures & processes.

Make recommendations on calendaring software improvements and/or adjustments.

Create and maintain resource guides.

Troubleshoot software problems with calendar program vendor. 



MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:



Excellent organizational and communication skills.

Strong attention to detail.

Ability to manage and prioritize work efficiently.

Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint).

Strong knowledge of State and Federal court Rules.

Ability to read through Court Orders to determine calendarable dates.

Ability to research local rules.

Legal citation and legal terminology expertise. Understanding of court rules and protocols and knowledge of calendaring deadlines. 

Strong knowledge of CompuLaw Vision or similar calendar/docket software.



Education

A four-year degree or, a two-year degree plus a paralegal certificate from an ABA qualified program is preferred.  Work experience in lieu of degree is also acceptable. 



Experience:

7+ years of docketing or equivalent experience in a law firm or legal services environment is required.

Large law firm experience is preferred.





		Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Vets/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.
WORKING CONDITIONS

		

		The following table indicates the degree of working conditions expected for the job.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to meet these requirements.
